biogHist.abstract: Child abuse has been suffered by some people who were in out-of-home care as children. It refers to the behaviours of others (usually adults) against children. These behaviours include: maltreatment, physical and psychological abuse and neglect, sexual abuse, and witnessing family violence.
biogHist.p: In 2010, a National Child Protection Clearinghouse research paper defined the types of child abuse that children needed to be protected from in Australia:

list.item: Maltreatment (Note that in practice the terms child abuse and child neglect are used more frequently than the term child maltreatment)

biogHist.p: Detailed descriptions of each type of child abuse are available in the publication 'Australian legal definitions: when is a child in need of protection?'

Sexual abuse of children is never the child's fault. The Children and Community Services Act 2004 Western Australia (Division 9A, s.124A) makes this quite clear in the way it defines sexual abuse in relation to a child. It includes sexual behaviour in circumstances where:

list.item: the child is the subject of bribery, coercion, a threat, exploitation or violence; or
the child has less power than another person involved in the behaviour; or
there is a significant disparity in the developmental function or maturity of the child and another person involved in the behaviour.

biogHist.p: In 2012, a Special Inquiry into sexual abuse of children at St Andrew's Hostel (Katanning, WA) during the period 1975-1990 found that people in authority had repeatedly ignored or actively diverted reports of sexual abuse. The Inquiry's report, St Andrew's Hostel Katanning: How the system and society failed our children explored the factors which contributed to this inaction, including creating a climate of fear and intimidation within the hostel and 'grooming the community' outside it.

An overview of the growing awareness of child abuse as a field of social work practice in Western Australia was given during testimony to the the Inquiry by the former Director of the Department for Community Welfare, Mr Keith Maine.
The release of the report on 17 September 2012 prompted an apology to victims of abuse by the Western Australian parliament.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Advisory and Co-ordinating Committee on Child Abuse [ACCCA] (c. 1984 - c. 1994)

descriptiveNote.p: The Advisory and Co-ordinating Committee on Child Abuse was set up to help prevent and improve the response to child abuse in WA.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Special Inquiry into St Andrew's Hostel [Katanning], State of Western Australia (2011 - 2012)

descriptiveNote.p: The Children and Community Services Act 2004 defines various forms of child abuse in terms of the Department's responsibilities for care and protection, and outlines responses such as reporting requirements.
Broken Rites monitors allegations of child abuse by clergy.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Redress WA, State of Western Australia (2008 - 2011)
Inquiry into Response by Government Agencies to Complaints of Family Violence and Child Abuse in Aboriginal Communities (2001 - 2002)
Inquiry into Children in Institutional Care, Parliament of Australia (2003 - 2005)
Inquiry into the Welfare of Former British Child Migrants, House of Commons Health Committee, Parliament of the United Kingdom (1997 - 1998)
National Inquiry into the Separation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Children from Their Families (1995 - 1997)
Apology by the government of Western Australia to the victims of abuse at St Andrew's Hostel, Katanning (19 September 2012)
Acts Amendment (Evidence of Children and Others) Act 1992

descriptiveNote.p: A panel was established in 1984 to investigate child abuse and how it was dealt with in Western Australia.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Ministerial Advisory Council on Child Protection [I, Western Australia] (2003 - 2008?)

descriptiveNote.p: Since 2004, a Ministerial Advisory Council has provided advice to the Minister on child protection issues.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Historical Institutional Abuse Inquiry, Northern Ireland (2013 - )

descriptiveNote.p: An Inquiry into the abuse of children in institutions in Northern Ireland between 1922 and 1995 started in 2013.
A Task Force was established in 1986 to investigate child sexual abuse and how it was dealt with in Western Australia.
Incest is a form of child sexual abuse. The Incest Survivors Association Inc offers support for people who have experienced this in their family.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Ministerial Advisory Council on Child Protection [II, Western Australia] (2009 - )

descriptiveNote.p: The Ministerial Advisory Council on Child Protection advises the Minister on child protection matters, including child abuse in WA.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Western Australian Child Protection Council (1997 - c. 2002)

descriptiveNote.p: The WA Child Protection Council was set up to advise the Minister on child protection matters in Western Australia.

A case of child abuse in 1892 was raised in Parliament during debate on the Industrial and Reformatory Schools Act 1893. A 'girl' had been made pregnant in her service placement and the Orphanage that placed her there reportedly made no attempt to help her during the pregnancy.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Royal Commission appointed to Inquire into the Care and Reform of Youthful Delinquents, State of Western Australia (1943)

descriptiveNote.p: Sexual abuse of young offenders at Barton's Mill prison was reported in evidence to the Royal Commission appointed to Inquire into the Care and Reform of Youthful Delinquents.

archref.abstract: 'Prime Minister says sorry' is a video of the Prime Minister Kevin Rudd giving a national apology to the Forgotten Australians and Former Child Migrants in the Great Hall of Parliament House in Canberra.

archref.repository: Department for Child Protection and Family Support, Department for Community Welfare, Western Australia , Annual Report 1976, p.28
archref.abstract: 'Battered child conference' is a digital copy of an image included (p.28) in the Annual Report 1976 of the Department for Community Welfare. The caption reads, 'Part of the audience at the opening'.
archref.note: Department for Child Protection and Family Support
